content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a Julia function that should meet your requirements:
```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(md, "\n") # Split the document into lines
    
    # Find all code blocks (ignoring code fences) and join them together
    code_blocks = filter(line -> startswith(line, "```"), lines)[2:end] |> x -> join(x, "\n")
    
    return code_blocks
end
```
To use this function, you can pass your markdown document as a string to the `extract_julia_code` function. The function will return a single string containing all the Julia code blocks joined together with newlines.
